channel.title: Security on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Security on Home

item.title: Friday Frida Hacking without the Why
item.description:
A brief but somewhat fun introduction to compromising data integrity on an Android application. **

This article will give an overview of setting up a rooted Android emulator, installing a tool called Frida, creating Frida scripts to intercept code at runtime, and replacing data in an application.

item.title: Man-in-the-Middle
item.description:
A man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack is a network security attack where a malicious device enters a network and intercepts traffic between nodes or components.

To accomplish access to a network an attacker needs an entry point.
There are many ways for a malicious device to accomplish access into a network.

item.title: Mitmproxy and Android
item.description:
Introduction

Debugging network traffic for your app can be useful, and sometimes necessary if the data is not what is expected or inconsistent.

The Proxy

I prefer the open source proxy [mitmproxy](https://mitmproxy.org =300x203). Easy to install on OSX with homebrew.

brew install mitmproxy
